text:
We are using the Apache Web Server 2.2.17 as the proxy server and the backend server is Oracle AS 10g.  We occassionally encountered a proxy error when browsing the Web pages.  We checked the error log of the Apache Server and the following errors were found:

[Wed Apr 13 15:11:50 2011] [error] [client 203.185.5.30] (70014)End of file found: proxy: error reading status line from remote server www.abcd.com, referer: https://www.abcd.com/prod/jsp_public/authen/online_services.jsp
[Wed Apr 13 15:11:50 2011] [error] [client 203.185.5.30] proxy: Error reading from remote server returned by /prod/jsp_public/authen/portal_redirect.jsp, referer: https://www.abcd.com/prod/jsp_public/authen/online_services.jsp

Is there any fix or workaround for this issue?
creator: stephen_chan@azeus.com
covener@gmail.com
text: Do you have any trace that implies the status line came over just fine and Apache mishandled it? You should work with your AS vendor.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text: NEEDINFO for almost a year, closing
